rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Lin Laoshi is a spectacular language teacher. Good use of technologies, lots of individual help. Learning Chinese is very hard, but Lin laoshi makes it enjoyable. Looking forward to CHIN 203!

Lin Laoshi is very sweet and is there for help if you ask her.  She responds quickly to emails and will even help you practice speaking Chinese outside of class.  Grammar points in Chinese are difficult, but she tries to explain them to the best of her abilities.  Overall, a good professor.
Lin Laoshi is strict but very helpful and kind. If you ask for help, she will have tutoring sessions with you to help you.
Lin Lao shi is strict but very helpful and kind. If you ask for help, she will have tutoring sessions with you to help you.

She is extremely hard and doesn't explain things very clearly, her tests are pretty hard in terms of the grammar portion and she expects you to come into this class with already having a ton of experience with speaking chinese. I would not take this class with Professor Lin if possible

She's a wonderful person, very sweet. We have trouble understanding grammar points sometimes, mostly because they can be so atypical, but as a class, we talk it out with her help. Really enjoyed her as a teacher for 102 and 204

Very weak teacher overall. She often gives unclear explanations of grammar, and is rarely able to give satisfactory answers to questions. Her tests are relatively easy, but they occasionally include material that has not been covered in class. In class. speaks.more English than Chinese and gives unclear directions for exercises. Much wasted time.

She is a very sweet teacher, and unintentionally funny sometimes, but her methods of teaching aren't nearly as clear as other Chinese language professors at UNC. She is not helpful in terms of helping you in Chinese, but if you need to miss class or re-schedule a quiz, she is pretty lenient.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I have had Ge Laoshi for 102, 203, and am about to take her for 204. I can't put into words how much I've enjoyed taking classes with her. She's such a friendly helpful person, and a fantastic teacher. Her lectures are informative and very interactive and full of practice. She does grade kind of tough sometimes and hw is lengthy, but she is perf.
Great teacher, but yeah you will work your butt off, she doesn't go easy on anyone -- especially if you haven't had experience with Chinese.
Very enthusiastic and friendly. Makes a difficult language manageable. Such a great addition to the Chinese Department.

She is passionate about teaching and incredibly well-prepared for class. She certainly doesn't grade easily, but grades inline with the rest of the Chinese department. Her class is interactive and she expects you to preview your lessons. Her weakness is pronunciation, she won't correct you at all, so you should probably  get a language partner!

Ge Laoshi is great! I've had 101-203 with her so far and will be in her 204 class. She's a clear presenter and prepares you well for each test while making chinese interactive and interesting. Her pronunciation of Chinese and English is great.
I love her! Taking her next semester for 102, she's an excellent teacher and so nice!

Lini Ge was very sweet. She's willing to help when you ask. You use the textbook only for looking at vocab and a couple of speaking exercises. Its easiness all depends on you. You need to study because Chinese is a hard language to learn but she doesn't mind working with you. Definitely going to try and get her for Chin 102

Ge Laoshi is amazing.  She is so friendly, and I think she may be one of the best teachers in the department, despite her recent integration into the teaching field.  Everyday I'm enthused to go to class and ready to practice.  Be prepared for quite a bit of vocabulary and regular participation though (2-5 times per class)!
really nice and sweet and always willing to help. past-moving class though - definitely much studying, as with most language classes!
